page.title: 10White Notley School
page.content: There has been a school on the present site for about{130 years}and the original building is still in use. The school is a Church of England controlled school and what is now the school playing field was originally part of the Vicarage garden. The original buiding had an extension built on about 15 years ago for the youngest children, a first demountable room about six years ago and a second demountable in May 1985. The school has 100 children for the first time in many years and has four classrooms. The school has children from White Notley but also from Black Notley and Faulkbourne because the schools in these villages closed down several years ago. Well over half the children are brought to school by bus each day.
